paragraphs.zh-tw: （吹口哨）♫（觀眾掌聲）謝謝大家！（觀眾掌聲）非常感謝大家！
paragraphs.en: (Whistling) (Whistling ends) Thank you. Thank you very much.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 剛剛那是吹口哨。我試試看以英文來說。
paragraphs.en: That was whistling. I'm trying to do this in English.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 好一個圓滾滾的，從荷蘭來的捲毛傢伙--他為什麼在吹口哨？事實上，我從4歲開始吹口哨--大約4歲。我父親常常在我家四處吹口哨，而我以爲那是我們家人的溝通方式。
paragraphs.en: What is a chubby,curly-haired guy from Holland -- why is he whistling? Well actually, I've been whistlingsince the age of four, about four. My dad was always whistlingaround the house, and I just thought that's partof communication in my family.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 所以我也和他一樣地吹口哨。而且直到我34歲，我還常常以口哨逗人及煩人。因為，說真的，我的吹口哨算是一種不正常的行為。
paragraphs.en: So I whistled along with him. And actually, until I was 34, I always annoyed and irritatedpeople with whistling, because, to be honest, my whistling is a kindof deviant behavior.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我自顧自的吹口哨，我在教室裡吹口哨，我騎腳踏車時吹口哨，在任何地方我都可以吹口哨。而且我也在聖誕節前夕與我太太娘家的聚會裏吹口哨，
paragraphs.en: I whistled alone,I whistled in the classroom, I whistled on bike, I whistled everywhere. And I also whistledat a Christmas Eve party with my family-in-law.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我想，這讓他們聖誕節音樂有點糟糕。而每當我聽到的音樂是我不喜歡的，我會試著去改良。
paragraphs.en: And they had some, in my opinion,terrible Christmas music. And when I hear music that I don't like,I try to make it better.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 所以《紅鼻子馴鹿-魯道夫》大家知道這首歌曲嗎？（吹口哨）♫然而它的旋律也可以像這樣。（吹口哨）♫但是在聖誕節的聚會--其實是在晚餐時--這會是非常惱人的。所以我的嫂嫂/弟妹
paragraphs.en: So when "Rudolph the Red-NosedReindeer" -- you know it? (Whistling) But it can also sound like this. (Whistling) But during a Christmas party -- at dinner, actually -- it's very annoying.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 跟我說了幾次：「請不要再吹口哨。」可我就是停不下來。在晚餐上--我喝了一些葡萄酒，我得承認這一點--在晚餐上我說：「如果有吹口哨的比賽，我一定會去參加。」在兩個星期後我收到一個簡訊：「你要出發去美國。」所以，好，我要出發去美國。我很願意去，但是為啥呢？
paragraphs.en: So my sister-in-law asked me a few times,"Please stop whistling." And I just couldn't. And at one point -- and I had some wine,I have to admit that -- at one point I said,"If there was a contest, I would join." And two weeks later, I received a text message:"You're going to America." So, OK, I'm going to America.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 所以我馬上打電話給她，這是一定要的。她在Google的網站，發現這場世界吹口哨大賽在美國，當然了。
paragraphs.en: I would love to, but why? So I immediately called her up, of course. She googled, and she foundthis World Whistling Championship in America, of course.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 她沒有想到我會去。可我也不能丟自己的臉。
paragraphs.en: She didn't expect me to go there. And I would have lost my face.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我不知道這算不算是正確的英文。不過如果這裡有荷蘭人一定能明白我的意思。
paragraphs.en: I don't know if that's correct English. But the Dutch people herewill understand what I mean.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我丟了我的臉。（觀眾掌聲）然後她想：「他永遠不可能去那裡。」不過事實上我做到了。
paragraphs.en: I lost my face. And she thought, "He will never go there." But actually, I did.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 所以我去了北卡羅萊納州的路易斯堡，位於美國的東南方，我走進了吹口哨的世界。並且參加了世界吹口哨大賽，我贏得了2004年的冠軍。（觀眾掌聲）那真是---
paragraphs.en: So I went to Louisburg, North Carolina,southeast of the United States, and I entered the world of whistling. And I also entered the World Championship, and I won there, in 2004.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 那真的是非常有趣，當然了。為了保持我的頭銜--各位知道的，跟一般人以及運動員一樣--我想，讓我們回到2005年我又贏了。之後有幾年我無法參加。
paragraphs.en: That was great fun, of course. And to defend my title --like judokas do and sportsmen -- I thought, well let's go back in 2005 -- and I won again.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 然後在2008年我再次參加在日本東京，我再次獲勝。
paragraphs.en: Then I couldn't participatefor a few years. And in 2008, I entered againin Japan, Tokyo, and I won again.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 所以現在的情況是這樣我在鹿特丹港，這美麗的城市，站在一個大型表演台上，談論吹口哨的話題。實際上我在吹口哨的同時也賺到了錢。
paragraphs.en: So what happened now is I'm standing here in Rotterdam,in the beautiful city, on a big stage, and I'm talking about whistling. And actually, I earn my moneywhistling, at the moment.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 所以我辭掉了護士的工作。（觀眾掌聲）而且我試著來實踐我的夢想。其實，以吹口哨爲生從來不是我的夢想，但這聽起來很棒。（觀眾掌聲）
paragraphs.en: So I quit my day job as a nurse. And I try to live my dream -- well, actually, it was never my dream,but it sounds so good.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 好，我不是這裡唯一會吹口哨的人。你會說：「啥！你什麼意思？」事實上，你們也要一起吹口哨。
paragraphs.en: OK, I'm not the only one whistling here. You say, "Huh, what do you mean?" Well actually, you are goingto whistle along.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 然後相同的事情又會再發生：人們會彼此對望然後想：「噢，天啊！為什麼？我可以開溜嗎？」不行，你不可以。其實這很簡單。
paragraphs.en: And then always the same thing happens: people are watching each otherand think, "Oh, my God. Why? Can I go away?" No, you can't.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我接下來要吹的曲名是"Fête de la Belle."時間大約 80分鐘。
paragraphs.en: Actually, it's very simple. The track that I will whistleis called "Fête de la Belle." It's about 80 minutes long.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 不，不，不。只有4分鐘。首先我想先和大家演練一下你們的哨音。
paragraphs.en: No, no, no. It's four minutes long. And I want to first rehearsewith you your whistling.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 所以我吹出音調。（吹口哨）♫抱歉，我忘記一件事。你們哨音的音調要和我一樣。
paragraphs.en: Yes, so I whistle the tone. (Whistling) Sorry, I forgot one thing -- you whistle the same tone as me.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我聽到變化多端的音調。（吹口哨）♫這聼起來很不錯。聼起來很不錯。
paragraphs.en: I heard a wide variety of tones. (Geert Chatrou and audience whistling) (Whistling ends) This is very promising.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我來請技術人員開啟音樂。
paragraphs.en: This is very promising. I'll ask the techniciansto start the music.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 一旦開始，要大家一起吹的時候，我會給你們暗示然後我們再看看如何。喔，阿哈！我很抱歉，技術員。我已經很習慣了。
paragraphs.en: And if it's started,I just point where you whistle along, and we will see what happens. Oh, I'm so sorry, technicians.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 我自己來開啟好了。
paragraphs.en: I'm so used to that. I start it myself.

paragraphs.zh-tw: 好，音樂來了。（音樂）（吹口哨）♫好。
paragraphs.en: OK, here it is. (Music) (Whistling) (Whistling ends) (Music) OK.

paragraphs.zh-tw: （吹口哨）♫很簡單，對吧。（吹口哨）♫接下來是獨唱，我建議我一個人吹就好了。（吹口哨）♫（觀眾掌聲）Max Westerman：Geert Chatrou，世界吹口哨冠軍。Geert Chatrou：謝謝大家！謝謝大家！
paragraphs.en: (Whistling) It's easy, isn't it? (Whistling) Now comes the solo,I propose I do that myself, OK? (Music) (Whistling) Max Westerman: Geert Chatrou,the World Champion of Whistling. Geert Chatrou: Thank you. Thank you.

title: A Whistleblower You Haven T Heard
